title.raw: 《呂太后本紀》Annals of Empress Dowager Lü

sentences.zh: 呂太后者，高祖微時妃也，生孝惠帝、女魯元太后。

translations.literal: Lu Empress Dowager, Gao Zu humble time consort, gave birth Xiao Hui Emperor, female Lu Yuan Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Dowager Lü was Gaozu's consort during his humble times. She gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and the female Empress Dowager Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 及高祖為漢王，得定陶戚姬，愛幸，生趙隱王如意。

translations.literal: When Gao Zu was Han Wang, got Dingtao Qi Ji, loved favored, gave birth Zhao Yin Wang Ruyi.
translations.idiomatic: When Gaozu became Han King, he obtained Concubine Qi from Dingtao. He loved and favored her. She gave birth to King Yin of Zhao, Ruyi.

sentences.zh: 孝惠為人仁弱，高祖以為不類我，常欲廢太子，立戚姬子如意，如意類我。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui as person benevolent weak, Gao Zu considered not like me, often wished abolish crown prince, establish Qi Ji son Ruyi, Ruyi like me.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaohui was benevolent and weak as a person. Gaozu considered him unlike himself. He often wished to abolish the crown prince and establish Concubine Qi's son Ruyi, for Ruyi was like him.

sentences.zh: 戚姬幸，常從上之關東，日夜啼泣，欲立其子代太子。

translations.literal: Qi Ji favored, often followed emperor to Guan Dong, day night wept cried, wished establish her son replace crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Concubine Qi was favored. She often followed the emperor to Guandong. Day and night she wept and cried, wishing to establish her son to replace the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 呂后年長，常留守，希見上，益疏。

translations.literal: Lu Hou years old, often stayed defended, rarely saw emperor, increasingly distant.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü was older. She often stayed to defend. She rarely saw the emperor. She became increasingly distant.

sentences.zh: 如意立為趙王後，幾代太子者數矣，賴大臣爭之，及留侯策，太子得毋廢。

translations.literal: Ruyi established as Zhao Wang after, nearly replaced crown prince times several, relied ministers contended it, and Liu Hou strategy, crown prince got not abolished.
translations.idiomatic: After Ruyi was established as King of Zhao, he nearly replaced the crown prince several times. It relied on ministers contending against it, and Marquis Liu's strategy, that the crown prince was not abolished.

translations.literal: Empress Dowager Lü was Gaozu's consort during his humble times. She gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and the female Empress Dowager Lu Yuan. When Gaozu became Han King, he obtained Concubine Qi from Dingtao. He loved and favored her. She gave birth to King Yin of Zhao, Ruyi. Emperor Xiaohui was benevolent and weak as a person. Gaozu considered him unlike himself. He often wished to abolish the crown prince and establish Concubine Qi's son Ruyi, for Ruyi was like him. Concubine Qi was favored. She often followed the emperor to Guandong. Day and night she wept and cried, wishing to establish her son to replace the crown prince. Empress Lü was older. She often stayed to defend. She rarely saw the emperor. She became increasingly distant. After Ruyi was established as King of Zhao, he nearly replaced the crown prince several times. It relied on ministers contending against it, and Marquis Liu's strategy, that the crown prince was not abolished.

sentences.zh: 呂后為人剛毅，佐高祖定天下，所誅大臣多呂后力。

translations.literal: Lu Hou as person firm resolute, assisted Gao Zu pacified world, what executed ministers many Lu Hou strength.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü was firm and resolute as a person. She assisted Gaozu in pacifying the world. The ministers who were executed were mostly through Empress Lü's strength.

sentences.zh: 呂后兄二人，皆為將。

translations.literal: Lu Hou elder brothers two people, all were generals.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü had two elder brothers. They were both generals.

sentences.zh: 長兄周呂侯死事，封其子呂臺為酈侯，子產為交侯；

translations.literal: Elder brother Zhou Lu Hou died affairs, enfeoffed his son Lu Tai as Li Hou, Zi Chan as Jiao Hou;
translations.idiomatic: The elder brother Lord Zhou Lü died in service. His son Lü Tai was enfeoffed as Lord Li, and Zichan as Lord Jiao;

sentences.zh: 次兄呂釋之為建成侯。

translations.literal: Second brother Lu Shi Zhi was Jiancheng Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The second brother Lü Shizhi was Lord Jiancheng.

translations.literal: Empress Lü was firm and resolute as a person. She assisted Gaozu in pacifying the world. The ministers who were executed were mostly through Empress Lü's strength. Empress Lü had two elder brothers. They were both generals. The elder brother Lord Zhou Lü died in service. His son Lü Tai was enfeoffed as Lord Li, and Zichan as Lord Jiao; The second brother Lü Shizhi was Lord Jiancheng.

sentences.zh: 高祖十二年四月甲辰，崩長樂宮，太子襲號為帝。

translations.literal: Gao Zu twelfth year fourth month Jia Chen, passed Chang Le palace, crown prince inherited title as emperor.
translations.idiomatic: In Gaozu's twelfth year, fourth month, Jia Chen day, he passed away in Changlegong palace. The crown prince inherited the title as emperor.

sentences.zh: 是時高祖八子：長男肥，孝惠兄也，異母，肥為齊王；

translations.literal: At this time Gao Zu eight sons: eldest son Fei, Xiao Hui elder brother, different mother, Fei was Qi Wang;
translations.idiomatic: At this time Gaozu had eight sons: the eldest son Fei, who was Emperor Xiaohui's elder brother from a different mother, Fei was King of Qi;

sentences.zh: 餘皆孝惠弟，戚姬子如意為趙王，薄夫人子恒為代王，諸姬子子恢為梁王，子友為淮陽王，子長為淮南王，子建為燕王。

translations.literal: Remainder all Xiao Hui younger brothers, Qi Ji son Ruyi was Zhao Wang, Bo Furen son Heng was Dai Wang, various Ji sons Zi Hui was Liang Wang, Zi You was Huaiyang Wang, Zi Chang was Huainan Wang, Zi Jian was Yan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The remainder were all Emperor Xiaohui's younger brothers. Concubine Qi's son Ruyi was King of Zhao. Lady Bo's son Heng was King of Dai. The various concubines' sons: Zihui was King of Liang, Ziyou was King of Huaiyang, Zichang was King of Huainan, Zijian was King of Yan.

sentences.zh: 高祖弟交為楚王，兄子濞為吳王。

translations.literal: Gao Zu younger brother Jiao was Chu Wang, elder brother son Pi was Wu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu's younger brother Jiao was King of Chu. His elder brother's son Pi was King of Wu.

sentences.zh: 非劉氏功臣番君吳芮子臣為長沙王。

translations.literal: Not Liu clan meritorious minister Fan Jun Wu Rui son Chen was Changsha Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The non-Liu clan meritorious minister Lord Fan's Wu Rui's son Chen was King of Changsha.

translations.literal: In Gaozu's twelfth year, fourth month, Jia Chen day, he passed away in Changlegong palace. The crown prince inherited the title as emperor. At this time Gaozu had eight sons: the eldest son Fei, who was Emperor Xiaohui's elder brother from a different mother, Fei was King of Qi; The remainder were all Emperor Xiaohui's younger brothers. Concubine Qi's son Ruyi was King of Zhao. Lady Bo's son Heng was King of Dai. The various concubines' sons: Zihui was King of Liang, Ziyou was King of Huaiyang, Zichang was King of Huainan, Zijian was King of Yan. Gaozu's younger brother Jiao was King of Chu. His elder brother's son Pi was King of Wu. The non-Liu clan meritorious minister Lord Fan's Wu Rui's son Chen was King of Changsha.

sentences.zh: 呂后最怨戚夫人及其子趙王，乃令永巷囚戚夫人，而召趙王。

translations.literal: Lu Hou most resented Qi Furen and her son Zhao Wang, then ordered Yongxiang imprisoned Qi Furen, and summoned Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü most resented Concubine Qi and her son King of Zhao. She then ordered Concubine Qi imprisoned in the Yongxiang, and summoned the King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 使者三反，趙相建平侯周昌謂使者曰：「高帝屬臣趙王，趙王年少。

translations.literal: Envoys three times returned, Zhao chancellor Jianping Hou Zhou Chang said to envoys: 'Gao Di entrusted minister Zhao Wang, Zhao Wang young.
translations.idiomatic: The envoys returned three times. The Zhao chancellor Lord Jianping Zhou Chang said to the envoys: 'The High Emperor entrusted the minister with King of Zhao. King of Zhao is young.

sentences.zh: 竊聞太后怨戚夫人，欲召趙王并誅之，臣不敢遣王。

translations.literal: Secretly heard empress dowager resented Qi Furen, wished summon Zhao Wang and execute them, minister dared not send wang.
translations.idiomatic: I have secretly heard that the Empress Dowager resents Concubine Qi. She wishes to summon King of Zhao and execute them both. I dare not send the king.

sentences.zh: 王且亦病，不能奉詔。」

translations.literal: Wang moreover also ill, cannot obey decree.'
translations.idiomatic: The king is moreover also ill. He cannot obey the decree.'

sentences.zh: 呂后大怒，乃使人召趙相。

translations.literal: Lu Hou greatly angered, then made people summon Zhao chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü was greatly angered. She then sent people to summon the Zhao chancellor.

sentences.zh: 趙相徵至長安，乃使人復召趙王。

translations.literal: Zhao chancellor summoned to Chang'an, then made people again summon Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao chancellor was summoned to Chang'an. She then sent people to summon King of Zhao again.

sentences.zh: 王來，未到。

translations.literal: Wang came, not yet arrived.
translations.idiomatic: The king came, but had not yet arrived.

sentences.zh: 孝惠帝慈仁，知太后怒，自迎趙王霸上，與入宮，自挾與趙王起居飲食。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui Emperor compassionate benevolent, knew empress dowager anger, personally welcomed Zhao Wang Baxiang, with entered palace, personally embraced with Zhao Wang rising residing eating drinking.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaohui was compassionate and benevolent. He knew of the Empress Dowager's anger. He personally welcomed King of Zhao at Baxiang. He entered the palace with him. He personally embraced him and shared in his rising, residing, eating, and drinking.

sentences.zh: 太后欲殺之，不得閒。

translations.literal: Empress dowager wished kill him, not able opportunity.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager wished to kill him, but could not find an opportunity.

sentences.zh: 孝惠元年十二月，帝晨出射。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui first year twelfth month, emperor morning went out hunting.
translations.idiomatic: In Emperor Xiaohui's first year, twelfth month, the emperor went out hunting in the morning.

sentences.zh: 趙王少，不能蚤起。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang young, could not early rise.
translations.idiomatic: King of Zhao was young. He could not rise early.

sentences.zh: 太后聞其獨居，使人持酖飲之。

translations.literal: Empress dowager heard him alone residing, made people hold poisoned drink gave him.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager heard that he was residing alone. She sent people to give him poisoned wine.

sentences.zh: 犁明，孝惠還，趙王已死。

translations.literal: Li Ming, Xiao Hui returned, Zhao Wang already dead.
translations.idiomatic: At dawn, Emperor Xiaohui returned. King of Zhao was already dead.

sentences.zh: 於是乃徙淮陽王友為趙王。

translations.literal: Thereupon then moved Huaiyang Wang You to be Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King You of Huaiyang was moved to be King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 夏，詔賜酈侯父追謚為令武侯。

translations.literal: Summer, decree granted Li Hou father posthumous title Ling Wu Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, by decree Lord Li's father was granted the posthumous title Lord Ling Wu.

sentences.zh: 太后遂斷戚夫人手足，去眼，煇耳，飲瘖藥，使居廁中，命曰「人彘」。

translations.literal: Empress dowager then cut off Qi Furen hands feet, removed eyes, cauterized ears, gave mute medicine, made reside latrine middle, named 'human pig'.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager then cut off Concubine Qi's hands and feet, removed her eyes, cauterized her ears, gave her a mute medicine, and made her reside in the latrine. She named her 'human pig'.

sentences.zh: 居數日，乃召孝惠帝觀人彘。

translations.literal: Resided several days, then summoned Xiao Hui Emperor to view human pig.
translations.idiomatic: After several days, she summoned Emperor Xiaohui to view the human pig.

sentences.zh: 孝惠見，問，乃知其戚夫人，乃大哭，因病，歲餘不能起。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui saw, asked, then knew it Qi Furen, then greatly cried, because illness, year remainder could not rise.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaohui saw and asked. He then knew it was Concubine Qi. He then greatly cried. Because of illness, for over a year he could not rise.

sentences.zh: 使人請太后曰：「此非人所為。

translations.literal: Sent people petition empress dowager said: 'This not human conduct.
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to petition the Empress Dowager saying: 'This is not human conduct.

sentences.zh: 臣為太后子，終不能治天下。」

translations.literal: Minister as empress dowager son, finally cannot govern world.'
translations.idiomatic: I am the Empress Dowager's son. I can finally not govern the world.'

sentences.zh: 孝惠以此日飲為淫樂，不聽政，故有病也。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui because this daily drinking as lewd pleasure, not listened government, therefore had illness.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaohui because of this daily took drinking as lewd pleasure. He did not listen to government. Therefore he had illness.

I have secretly heard that the Empress Dowager resents Concubine Qi. She wishes to summon King of Zhao and execute them both. I dare not send the king. The king is moreover also ill. He cannot obey the decree.' Empress Lü was greatly angered. She then sent people to summon the Zhao chancellor. The Zhao chancellor was summoned to Chang'an. She then sent people to summon King of Zhao again. The king came, but had not yet arrived. Emperor Xiaohui was compassionate and benevolent. He knew of the Empress Dowager's anger. He personally welcomed King of Zhao at Baxiang. He entered the palace with him. He personally embraced him and shared in his rising, residing, eating, and drinking. The Empress Dowager wished to kill him, but could not find an opportunity. In Emperor Xiaohui's first year, twelfth month, the emperor went out hunting in the morning. King of Zhao was young. He could not rise early. The Empress Dowager heard that he was residing alone. She sent people to give him poisoned wine. At dawn, Emperor Xiaohui returned. King of Zhao was already dead. Thereupon King You of Huaiyang was moved to be King of Zhao. In summer, by decree Lord Li's father was granted the posthumous title Lord Ling Wu. The Empress Dowager then cut off Concubine Qi's hands and feet, removed her eyes, cauterized her ears, gave her a mute medicine, and made her reside in the latrine. She named her 'human pig'. After several days, she summoned Emperor Xiaohui to view the human pig. Emperor Xiaohui saw and asked. He then knew it was Concubine Qi. He then greatly cried. Because of illness, for over a year he could not rise. He sent people to petition the Empress Dowager saying: 'This is not human conduct. I am the Empress Dowager's son. I can finally not govern the world.' Emperor Xiaohui because of this daily took drinking as lewd pleasure. He did not listen to government. Therefore he had illness.

sentences.zh: 二年，楚元王、齊悼惠王皆來朝。

translations.literal: Second year, Chu Yuan Wang, Qi Dao Hui Wang all came court.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, King Yuan of Chu and King Dao Hui of Qi both came to court.

sentences.zh: 十月，孝惠與齊王燕飲太后前，孝惠以為齊王兄，置上坐，如家人之禮。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Xiao Hui with Qi Wang banquet drinking empress dowager before, Xiao Hui considered Qi Wang elder brother, placed upper seat, like family ritual.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Emperor Xiaohui banquet drank with King of Qi before the Empress Dowager. Emperor Xiaohui considered King of Qi his elder brother. He placed him in the upper seat, like family ritual.

sentences.zh: 太后怒，乃令酌兩卮酖，置前，令齊王起為壽。

translations.literal: Empress dowager angered, then ordered pour two goblets poison, placed before, ordered Qi Wang rise for longevity toast.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager was angered. She then ordered two goblets of poison poured and placed before them. She ordered King of Qi to rise for a longevity toast.

sentences.zh: 齊王起，孝惠亦起，取卮欲俱為壽。

translations.literal: Qi Wang rose, Xiao Hui also rose, took goblet wished together for longevity toast.
translations.idiomatic: King of Qi rose. Emperor Xiaohui also rose. He took the goblet wishing to together make a longevity toast.

sentences.zh: 太后乃恐，自起泛孝惠卮。

translations.literal: Empress dowager then feared, personally rose poured Xiao Hui goblet.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager then feared. She personally rose and poured Emperor Xiaohui's goblet.

sentences.zh: 齊王怪之，因不敢飲，詳醉去。

translations.literal: Qi Wang wondered it, because dared not drink, feigned drunk left.
translations.idiomatic: King of Qi wondered at it. Because he dared not drink, he feigned being drunk and left.

sentences.zh: 問，知其酖，齊王恐，自以為不得脫長安，憂。

translations.literal: Asked, knew it poison, Qi Wang feared, personally considered could not escape Chang'an, worried.
translations.idiomatic: He asked and knew it was poison. King of Qi feared. He personally considered he could not escape Chang'an. He worried.

sentences.zh: 齊內史士說王曰：「太后獨有孝惠與魯元公主。

translations.literal: Qi inner scribe scholar persuaded wang said: 'Empress dowager alone has Xiao Hui and Lu Yuan princess.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi inner scribe scholar persuaded the king saying: 'The Empress Dowager alone has Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 今王有七十餘城，而公主乃食數城。

translations.literal: Now wang has seventy remainder cities, but princess namely eats several cities.
translations.idiomatic: Now the king has over seventy cities, but the princess only eats several cities.

sentences.zh: 王誠以一郡上太后，為公主湯沐邑，太后必喜，王必無憂。」

translations.literal: Wang sincerely with one commandery offer empress dowager, as princess bathing city, empress dowager certainly happy, wang certainly without worry.'
translations.idiomatic: If the king sincerely offers one commandery to the Empress Dowager as the princess's bathing city, the Empress Dowager will certainly be happy. The king will certainly have no worries.'

sentences.zh: 於是齊王乃上城陽之郡，尊公主為王太后。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qi Wang then offered Chengyang commandery, honored princess as wang empress dowager.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King of Qi then offered the commandery of Chengyang. He honored the princess as Queen Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 呂后喜，許之。

translations.literal: Lu Hou happy, permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü was happy. She permitted it.

sentences.zh: 乃置酒齊邸，樂飲，罷，歸齊王。

translations.literal: Then set wine Qi residence, joyful drinking, finished, returned Qi Wang.
translations.idiomatic: She then set wine in the Qi residence. Joyful drinking. Finished. She returned King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 三年，方筑長安城，四年就半，五年六年城就。

translations.literal: Third year, just building Chang'an city, fourth year completed half, fifth sixth year city completed.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, they were just building Chang'an city. In the fourth year it was half completed. In the fifth and sixth years the city was completed.

sentences.zh: 諸侯來會。

translations.literal: Various marquises came assembly.
translations.idiomatic: The various marquises came to the assembly.

sentences.zh: 十月朝賀。

translations.literal: Tenth month court congratulations.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month they had court congratulations.

translations.literal: In the second year, King Yuan of Chu and King Dao Hui of Qi both came to court. In the tenth month, Emperor Xiaohui banquet drank with King of Qi before the Empress Dowager. Emperor Xiaohui considered King of Qi his elder brother. He placed him in the upper seat, like family ritual. The Empress Dowager was angered.
